chapter.para: The ECB SBC v2 is a CPM compatible single board computer with large ROM drive and a battery backed up RAM drive, a parallel interface that could connect to a IDE hard drive-like device via an additional board, and a serial port to act as console.

The Theory of Operation cannot hope to fully explain the entire board, but at least some helpful notes will be provided. Generally this should aim to exceed a simple list of features, without going into design detail. A good analogy is there is a physical walkthru at the start of the construction section, this section is more of a conceptual or theoretical walkthru.

Gold plate is less mechanically durable than tin, more corrosion resistant than the IC pins, and more expensive

chapter.para: A serial cable. VLM bought a 3 foot 9pin serial cable from Jameco part number 189333 for $3.25 on 2013-01-16, chopped the end off to connect to a PC. Also purchased a 5x2 female IDC connector from Jameco part number 742215 for $1.09 on 2013-01-27 to connect to the SBCv2. In between goes a length of 10 conductor ribbon cable, Jameco part number 639672 for $4.49 on 2013-01-27.

A ECB backplane can provide power to the SBCv2. If you plan to run your board off an existing, working ECB backplane board, you do not need to install a molex power socket on the SBCv2 or attach a separate power cable to the SBCv2, just plug it into a working backplane.

VLM uses a Jameco 175662 for $22.95 as of 2013-01-18 5 amp 5 volt switching power supply to turn 12 volt house power into 5 volts. You also need a female 4 pin molex plug off a burned out PC power supply to connect to the onboard connector. Also two #4 wood screws to mount it, some heat shrink tubing to protect the connections, and some crimp on screw terminals will complete the power supply. On the input of the 12 volt supply VLM uses powerpole connectors, a fuse might be a good idea too.

If you use a different source of 5 volt power, VLM suggests modifying the molex connector. Obtain a female molex PC 5.25 floppy drive power connector, perhaps cut off the end of a broken PC power supply cable. Remove the yellow +12 volt wire from the connector as the SBC v2 does not use 12 volts and this slightly reduces the risk of a wiring accident and also makes it a little lower insertion force..

A ZIF socket for the eprom can be mounted, but it will make the SBCv2 take up two backplane slots, which may or may not matter. The components required are a Jameco 104012 32 pin ZIF $9.95 as of 2013-02-17 and two machined 32 pin sockets used as spacers, Jameco 105381 $1.35 each as of 2013-02-17. Stick one machined pin socket onto the zif, then stack another machined pin socket on making a stack of 3 sockets, then stick the whole works into the board, hpefully the board was assembled with machined sockets so that the weight of the ZIF won't pull the stack out of the PCB soldered socket.
Some kind of battery backup for the ramdisk.
